meanings.definition: (verb) to make a shrill, discordant sound
meanings.sent1: The stray cat would caterwaul loudly at night.
meanings.sent2: The monkeys in the jungle caterwaul to communicate.
meanings.sent3: The caterwaul of the rusty old car made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sirens caterwaul through the city streets, creating chaos.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches caterwaul against the window, keeping me awake.

meanings.sent1: The caterwaul of the sirens filled the air.
meanings.sent2: The caterwaul of the baby woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent3: The caterwaul of the alarm clock startled me awake.
meanings.sent4: The caterwaul of the seagulls echoed across the beach.
meanings.sent5: The caterwaul of the thunderstorm made the dog hide under the bed.
